name: Sulfonal
Relationship: TRIONAL; insomnia associated with physical excitement; (vertigo, loss of equilibrium, ataxia, nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea, stertorous breathing, cyanosis, tinnitus, hallucination).

Head: Eyes bloodshot and restless
Double vision; heavy look about eyes; tinnitus, aphasia; tongue as if paralyzed
Double vision; ptosis; tinnitus; dysphagia, difficult speech
Dropsy, stupid; pain on attempting to raise head
Vertigo, unable to rise
Urine: Constant desire to urinate; scanty, brownish red
Mind: Alternation of happy, hopeful states with depression and weakness
Extremities: Stiffness and paralysis of both legs
Ataxic movements, staggering gait; cold, weak, trembling; legs seem too heavy

details: Vertigo of cerebral origin, cerebellar disease, ataxic symptoms and chorea, present a field for the homeopathic employment of this drug. PROFOUND WEAKNESS, gone, faint feeling, and despondency. Loss of control of sphincter. Muscular incoordination.
dosage: Third trituration. NON-HOMEOPATHIC USES. As a
